page.title: 09DAY TO DAY LIFE IN BARSBY 2
page.content: The lack of bus sevice and shops is a disadvantage to some residents particularly if they have no car. Mrs Jesson feels that Barsby is very cut off from the towns and that really to live in Barsby it is necessary to have a car. A facility in Barsby which is vital for the older people is the service vans which come to Barsby on different days of the week. There is a butchers, bakers, grocers and library van, and a milkman who delivers milk everyday. If people want to buy goods such as clothes then they usually travel to Leicester or Melton.
